description:
Gorilla Mind, a leading performance supplements and energy drinks brand, is searching for an experienced Senior Director of Sales, to play a lead role in the aggressive retail expansion and development/implementation of regional and national beverage distribution within the Convenience, FDM, and DSD network that aligns with the core business objectives of Gorilla Mind. In conjunction with the Chief Revenue Officer, and Vice President of Sales, this role will drive the identification of key expansion regions, formulate and optimize pricing and product rollout strategies, optimize supply chain efficiencies, work closely with the account and product brand managers, collaborate with marketing, and develop distribution partnerships that enhance the position of Gorilla Mind products within the marketplace and among its competitors.

The Senior Director of Sales should bring in-depth knowledge and understanding of the beverage industry and nutritional supplements space including a deep understanding of competitive brands and products. This person must bring excellent leadership, communication, financial knowledge, and customer service skills and be able to navigate complex sales and customer situations to reach brand goals. This is a leadership role that will work cross-functionally with leaders across our organization including Marketing, Finance, Legal, Supply Chain/Operations, and more, while providing ongoing direction and leadership with internal and external stakeholders.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Responsible for maximizing sales of Gorilla Mind products from a regional and national level by increasing brand awareness through distribution and corporate partnerships (Convenience, FDM and Distribution)
• Owns customer service, relationships, and growth with internal and external customers through the establishment of positive, profitable, selling relationships with key accounts to drive successful execution of plans in the market
• Leads cross-functional collaboration by partnering with other functional departments including product development, supply chain, and marketing to ensure shared expectations are met and exceeded
• Work closely with senior leadership and other leaders to communicate the needs of key distributors and/or customers, sales plans, inventory requirements, marketing opportunities, and any other aspects that impact the company achieving its business objectives.
• Training distributor sales reps and retail partners on our products through in market visits and office-based training sessions to educate them on our brand, products and selling into stores
• Tracking and reviewing accounts to discuss distributor and sales performance along with promotion and new product launch schedules in target regions
• Recommending and implementing sales programs and work with your regional distributor on short- and long-term sales strategies
• Provides honest assessments of the team for efficiency and improvement and resources for learning to create intentional developmental plans necessary to support continuous growth and expansion
• Highly energizing and motivational to the retail sales team members to achieve their assigned goals for the business.
• Helps recruit and hire retail sales team members while developing training programs as needed.
• Travel for in-person meetings with customers and partners to further develop key relationships.

Requirements:
• At least 7-10 years experience in a CPG and beverage environment leading a retail sales team.
• Minimum of 5 years experience in an influential sales leadership position.
• Proven track record of scaling business growth medium and large businesses (from $20MM-$100MM+) across multiple channels and customers.
• Brings high-level strategic planning, organizational, and creative thinking skills.
• In-depth knowledge of the nutritional supplement and beverages space, including knowledge of customer and consumer dynamics that impact success.
• Strong people skills and ability to lead and find solutions within ambiguous situations.
• Ability to travel to (up to 50%).
• Strong interpersonal skills and negotiation skills.
• Self-motivated and can work independently and proactively to resolve issues, take ownership of tools and processes, and lead with minimal supervision.
• Excellent leadership, communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills
• BA/BS or equivalent University degree. Master’s degree preferred.
• A passion for health and fitness, nutritional supplements, and/or functional food/beverage products is a plus.

Salary:
• $140-160,000/year DOE

Benefits:
• Health Insurance
• Dental Insurance
• Vision Insurance
• Health Savings Account (HSA)
• Paid Time Off (PTO)
• 6 Paid Holidays
• 401(k) Retirement Plan
• Parental leave
• Employee Discounts
